intro: Anathallis roseopapillosa, commonly known as the rose-papillate anathallis, is a species of orchid native to South America. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, hairy structures. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that are clustered in racemes, typical of the Orchidaceae family. Its habitat includes humid, shaded areas in cloud forests, where it thrives in the understory. Due to its limited distribution and specialized environment, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
